original: Lundh, Lars Åke, redaktör, Göte-’borg, f. 14/9/09’ i Gbg av Otto L. o. Maria Malmborg. G. 41 m. Barbro Nordström. Barn: Lars f. 44, Christi- na 46. — Stud. v. Gbgs latinlärov. Medarb. i Gbgs-Posten sed. 29. Gjort reportage i Norge, Danm., Lettl., Polen, Tjeckoslov., Tyskl., Frankr., Engl., Ital., Schweiz o. Amer., krigskorresp. i Polen 39. Ordf. i folkpart. ungd:-fören. i Gbg 39-43, styr :led. i folkpart. ungd:förb. m. fl. org. inom part., styr :led. i Flygjournalisternas klubb. Gbgs-Postens guldplak. f. journ :bragd.
translated: Lundh, Lars Åke, editor, Gothenburg, b. 14/9/09 in Gothenburg to Otto L. and Maria Malmborg. Married in 1941 to Barbro Nordström. Children: Lars b. 1944, Christina b. 1946. Studied at Gothenburg Latin School. Collaborated with Gothenburg Post since 1929. Done reporting in Norway, Denmark, Latvia, Poland, Czechoslovakia, Germany, France, England, Italy, Switzerland, and America. War correspondent in Poland in 1939. Chairman of the Young Liberal Party in Gothenburg from 1939 to 1943. Board member of the Young Liberal Association and other organizations within the party. Board member of the Aviation Journalists' Club. Received Gothenburg Post's gold plaque for journalistic achievements.
